lead_paragraph: The plan includes providing corridors for civilians to flee and amnesty to insurgents who lay down their arms — offers that were met with deep skepticism.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Maher Samaan from Paris, Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva, Eric Schmitt from Aspen, Co., and Mark Mazzetti from Washington.
byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and ANNE BARNARD

headline.print_headline: Syria Plans Aleppo Conquest, Backed by Russian Power
headline.main: Syria Outlines Plans for Conquest of Aleppo, Backed by Russian Power

snippet: The plan includes providing corridors for civilians to flee and amnesty to insurgents who lay down their arms — offers that were met with deep skepticism....
abstract: Syrian government announces plan take control of rebel-held districts in eastern Aleppo by opening corridors for civilians to leave and offering amnesty to insurgents who surrender; recent aid by Russian military has given Syria edge in years-long conflict by cutting off access to rebel-held regions, and making those areas inhospitable by destroying infrastructure.
